meanings.definition: A European artistic and literary movement of the early 20th century that sought to challenge traditional artistic conventions.
meanings.sent1: The dada movement was all about breaking the rules in art.
meanings.sent2: Many artists were inspired by dada to create unconventional pieces.
meanings.sent3: The dada artists painted with wild colors and strange shapes.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was like a dada masterpiece, chaotic yet captivating.
meanings.sent5: The dada movement shook up the art world with its bold ideas.

meanings.definition: A person who is considered to be silly or foolish.
meanings.sent1: He always acts like a dada, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a dada and take things seriously sometimes.
meanings.sent3: The dada in the group told jokes that made no sense.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a dada when she tripped over her own feet.
meanings.sent5: Being a dada can bring joy to those around you.

meanings.sent1: My dada helps me build sandcastles at the beach.
meanings.sent2: I love going fishing with my dada on weekends.
meanings.sent3: Dada always tells the best bedtime stories with funny voices.
meanings.sent4: To me, my dada is like a superhero who can fix anything.
meanings.sent5: Playing catch with dada is my favorite thing to do.
